data.title: My watering hole!
data.text:
There's a lot to tell here. I worked at the 3M campus from 2006 through 2014 and visited the Woodbury Starbucks quite often, 3 - 4 times per week. I have to have my caffeine kick. Over those years, you eventually become friends with the baristas and the manager, Irene. I became a regular of course. As soon as the baristas saw me drive up, they started making my special coffee drink: an Americano, 6 shots, Venti with room for cream.

It snows of course in Minnesota. I was caught in a December 2010 blizzard and had to park my car about 3/4 mile from my apartment. I began my trek home but the streets and sidewalks were all one. I expected a long, slow hike trudging through deep snow with more snow falling. A car pulled up beside me. It was Amy, one of the baristas, who recognized me! She gave me a much needed ride the rest of the way home. What a life saver! Later, I logged on to the Starbucks website and wrote a thank you to Amy through the Starbucks corporate comment link. 

Several months later, I asked Amy if she had received any compliments, pat on the back or or monetary reward from the Starbucks higher management for her efforts. Nada. So, I want you folks out there to know what Amy did (albeit several years later). She certainly deserves the recognition.

Fast forward to 2016. I was back in St. Paul for 3M meetings and stopped by the Starbucks at the Woodbury Plaza just last week. It was like old times - they remembered me and how to make my special drink! When you stop in, say hi to Irene and Amy. They will treat you like a king!

data.title: Great Coffee - slow drive thru
data.text: Good Coffee but if you are going through the drive thru or even inside be prepared to wait especially in the morning.

data.title: just like the other SB stores
data.text: The old and good coffee, as good as in any other Starbucks store. That time instead of coffee, I tried the hot chocolate and that was great! I recommend.

data.title: Not very good
data.text: This was not our favorite experience at a Starbucks for sure. I ordered my usual mint tea, and no matter how long it steeped- ie: an hour! - it didn't taste like much more than water.  My daughter ordered some kind of frapp... Caramel flan something ( it's different every time :) ), and that was blended better than usual she said. The man behind the counter seemed disinterested in us. It was the middle of the afternoon, they were slow, so I would think they would be happy to have someone there spending money.

data.title: quick and courteous service
data.text:
great staff and location - not crazy crowded 
efficiently served our group of 5 - accommodating a myriad of special orders for beverages

data.title: Hot Coffee, Friendly Servers
data.text: I was stuck completing a paper for school at this Starbucks for several hours and I was surprised at how friendly the servers were during my long stay. I bought several pastries and refills of coffee, and they were very pleasant to me. I really appreciated their friendly demeanor and it made a rough day much better.

data.title: Best customer service
data.text: Some of the nicest servers I've met in any of the Starbucks I've frequented.  Fast service with a smile.
